item.title: All Character Cosmetics in Battlefield 6
item.description:
Battlefield 6 thrusts players into epic, realistic battles with some of the most atmospheric and cinematic moments in multiplayer gaming, and much to the relief of FPS fans, it completely ditches goofy character aesthetics in favor of skins that are based off real military gear. Every player looks like they belong in a warzone, and best of all, some of these cosmetics are actually free to earn.

The two warring factions in Battlefield 6 involve more than just a handful of faceless men and women. Like in previous games in the series, soldiers from multiple nations are involved here, and players can pick and choose who they want to play anytime they're out of a match. Here's a look at all the character skins in BF6 (including both paid and free ones) and how to unlock them.

How to Change Character Skins in Battlefield 6

From the main menu, head to the Loadout tab, then select the Appearance button in the row at the bottom of your screen . From here, you'll be able to select your individual soldiers and select the skins you want to use on them.

Keep in mind that there are multiple soldiers available to players per class , and each soldier has their own set of skins . The majority of them are just simple color/camo swaps, while others feature entirely different models .

How to Unlock Character Skins in Battlefield 6

The majority of BF6 character skins are unlocked by completing challenges. Some were available only during the beta, and others could only be obtained by completing a limited-time free season pass for Battlefield 2042 . The rest are either paid, or are unlocked by doing the following:

  • Complete the Battlefield 6 campaign
  • Complete class-specific challenges

Each class also has Mastery skins that drastically change how a character looks compared to their default appearance. To get them, you need to complete the third and final tier of challenges tied to each class .

As of writing, only the default units for NATO and Pax Armata have unique mastery skins. Completing the same Tier 3 class challenges unlock different camos/colors for the other faction units.

All NATO Skins in Battlefield 6

NATO is the stand-in for the usual US team seen in previous Battlefield games, and much like its real-world counterpart, this faction uses equipment commonly used by Western countries. Expect to see gear and vehicles used by America and its allies when playing as NATO in BF6 .

Coyote Squad

Members of Coyote Squad represent American soldiers in Battlefield 6, and by default, they wear uniforms and equipment similar to the ones used by the US military.

Coyote Squad - Mastery Skins

These skins, as well as the ones for Pax Armata's Fireteam Vedmak unit, can be obtained by completing class-based challenges in BF6 . You can find these challenges by going to Main Menu->Challenges->Class.

United Albion

United Albion is composed of British troops wearing a slightly less saturated multicam battle uniform Much like Coyote Squad, each soldier in this unit has their own backstories.

Desert Locusts

The Desert Locusts are airborne troops from Egypt's Rapid Deployment Forces. They wear chocolate chip camo uniforms to match the sandy dunes of their home locale.

All Pax Armata Skins in Battlefield 6

The Pax Armata is a fictional paramilitary organization inspired by different African and European armed forces. They are composed of soldiers from Northern and Eastern Europe as well as North Africa, Gibraltar, Democratic Republic of the Congo, and Algeria. In-game, Pax Armata uses fictional vehicles and ones that resemble German and Russian war machines.

Fireteam Vedmak

Fireteam Vedmak was assembled from Pax Armata's recruitment efforts in the Balkan regions. These soldiers are experts who use speed and stealth to defeat the enemy, and they wear olive drab gear with green camo to blend in with foliage.

Fireteam Vedmak Mastery Skins

Espada

This Pax Armata unit contains a multinational ensemble of fighters who now play a central role in the Tajikistan theater. They wear tan vests with deep green uniforms for mountainside warfare.

Kahina Unité

Kahina Unité is comprised of North African fighters with roots in Algeria. They are an airborne battalion with uniforms that match the battlefields across the Iberian Peninsula.

All Phantom Edition Class Skins in Battlefield 6

Players who purchase the game's Phantom Edition get a set of black-and-red themed skins for members of NATO's Coyote squad. These Phantom skins can only be equipped on these specific characters.

All Battlefield 2042 Reward Skins in Battlefield 6

The Road to Battlefield 6 event in BF2042 included a number of skins for players to equip in BF6 . This includes skins for the M45A1 and M44 pistols, as well as the Commander and Sovereign Soldier skins for the Pax Armata Espada Engineer and NATO Coyote Squad Support respectively. Keep in mind that skins are exclusive to each faction's individual characters, and they cannot be equipped by anyone else.

Battlefield 6
9 /10
9.6 /10
Released
October 10, 2025

item.title: Open-World Game Franchises That Keep Getting Bigger
item.description:
Open-world games are known for having big and expansive areas that players are able to explore at their leisure, but most of the time, the developers of these titles will inevitably end up minimizing the scope after a few entries. Whether this is because the worlds are simply becoming too large to deal with, or simply due to the developers wanting to focus on a more linear story, there are many reasons why an open-world franchise will start getting a little smaller over time, but that's not to say that every open-world franchise out there has followed this trend.

In stark contrast, there are some that just keep getting bigger with every new installment, not just in terms of the world they offer, but also the amount of content and activities that players can partake in along their adventure. It's gotten to the point where it's hard to imagine how these franchises can get even bigger, considering how bold and ambitious they have already become, but if anything, this only gets fans more excited to jump into each new entry, which is especially the case with these popular open-world franchises listed below.

Grand Theft Auto

Rockstar Continues Creating Giant Worlds Full Of Side Activities And Characters To Meet

  • Number Of Mainline Games: 5
  • Developers: Rockstar Games

Many people credit Grand Theft Auto 3 for being the game that ushered the open-world genre into the mainstream, and while it definitely deserves this prestigious reputation, it's honestly kind of funny looking back at just how small that world actually was compared to modern-day standards. With the map containing just over 1.45 square miles of land, Rockstar clearly realized they needed to make the cities even bigger for future games, to make players feel as if they're truly living in a believable and realistic area where they can cause as much chaos as they like.

While Grand Theft Auto 4 and San Andreas began adding in a plethora of new mission types and specific areas across the city could be visited, it was really the fifth mainline entry that took the size and scope of the world to a whole new level. To put it simply, Los Santos is absolutely huge, to the point where exploring every part of it, from the bustling streets to the lush mountains, can end up taking several days, or even weeks, but this is a big reason why the game has become such a smash hit, since it's just such a blast uncovering the staggering amount of content Rockstar has packed into this game.

Far Cry

Bigger Worlds, More Radio Towers, So Much Chaos

  • Number Of Mainline Games: 6
  • Developers: Ubisoft

While Ubisoft may have decided to cut down the size of their maps with Assassin's Creed Mirage for that series specifically, in the case of Far Cry , the worlds are only getting bigger with every new game. In Far Cry 2 , players were free to explore a visually stunning, but also dangerous, country in Africa, which was littered with treasure to obtain and an abundance of deadly weapons to acquire. With Far Cry 3, it was clear that Ubisoft wanted to give the player more things to do while exploring, and thanks to the introduction of radio towers, it allowed players to reveal what activities they could get involved with in each area of the map, ensuring there was always something to get up to as a result.

As the series has gone on, the maps have only been getting bigger, but thankfully, the addition of new content allows these areas to feel like places that are truly lived in, rather than just empty sandboxes. For example, in Far Cry 5 , players are able to recruit companions to help them take out enemy bases, while in the sixth game, there are also plenty of Unique Weapons that can be uncovered if the player takes the time to traverse as much of the map as possible in order to find them.

Horizon

Aloy's Adventures Are Becoming Longer And More Adventurous With Each New Game

  • Number Of Mainline Games: 2
  • Developers: Guerrilla Games

Despite following the traditional open-world gameplay formula, Sony's Horizon games are actually considered pretty unique in a few particular respects. A prime example of this is the enemy types being giant robotic dinosaurs that the protagonist, Aloy, must destroy by using an arsenal of makeshift weapons, including explosive arrows and deadly spears. In the first game, Horizon Zero Dawn, players could encounter all kinds of different dinos as they explored the giant open world, while also having the opportunity to help out a few of Aloy's friends along the way with their own personal struggles.

The hotly anticipated sequel, Horizon Forbidden West , decided to go even bigger in pretty much every aspect to give fans a sequel that built on what made the original so special. For example, the map is larger, and it contains a healthier variety of environmental diversity to ensure the journey never feels boring or predictable. Not only that, the number of dinosaurs has also been greatly expanded, along with the weapons and skills that Aloy can acquire once she sets off on her grand adventure.

Spider-Man

The Two Spideys Have A Few More Areas Of New York To Swing Through In The Sequel

  • Number Of Mainline Games: 2
  • Developers: Insomniac Games

While Insomniac's first open-world Spider-Man featured a huge map that would take several hours to fully explore, it was difficult to tell how big it was, considering the blistering speed at which Spidey can shoot through the city using his webs. With that being said, though, when looking at the absurd number of collectibles and extra missions that are dotted on the map, players will quickly realize that Manhattan is far from a small place, but in time, they will eventually be able to explore even more areas of New York City in the sequel, Spider-Man 2 .

This time around, Brooklyn and Queens have also been added to the game world, opening up brand new areas for players to explore, while still featuring iconic locales from the first game. While Peter Parker makes a return to save the city from danger once again, in the sequel, he's also joined by Miles, with players being able to switch between the two pretty much instantly in the middle of gameplay. Pair this with a longer story, way more exciting abilities to unlock, and a ton of unique boss enemies, and it's evident that Insomniac wanted to go as big as possible for the sequel. Whether they can go even further with the third game, only time will tell.

Red Dead

Rockstar's Cowboy Simulators Feature Giant Maps And Tons Of Content To Enjoy

  • Number Of Mainline Games: 3
  • Developers: Rockstar Games

The first game in the Red Dead franchise, Red Dead Revolver , flirted with the idea of going open-world, but was ultimately a fairly linear experience that primarily revolved around a single town. By the time that Rockstar started thinking about creating Red Dead Redemption , they had become one of the most popular and well-renowned developers in the industry, so going all in with the open-world formula was necessary to ensure the game didn't feel like an entry that belonged to a bygone error.

When crafting the world of Red Dead Redemption , Rockstar did an excellent job at making it as believable as possible by striking a balance between having areas that are full of chaos and combat, and those that are quieter and serene. They would build upon this with Red Dead Redemption 2 , which, to this day, contains one of the biggest open worlds ever seen in a game. With plenty of stranger missions to complete and a frankly jaw-dropping amount of side activities which are completely optional, Red Dead Redemption 2 's world never comes across like a giant chunk of empty space, but instead, a wild wasteland full of opportunities.

Watch Dogs

A Bigger City Simply Means More Gadgets For Players To Hack

  • Number Of Mainline Games: 3
  • Developers: Ubisoft

On the surface, Watch Dogs may seem like any other open-world game and how it looks and plays, but there's a specific mechanic that allows this series of games to feel drastically different from anything that has come before, and that's the ability to hack. In the first game, players were able to hack most of the gadgets and electronics in the environment to take down their enemies in creative ways, such as flicking on and off the traffic lights or simply tapping into someone's phone to distract them before sneaking for a fatal attack.

The truth is, though, the number of ways that players could actually use the hacking ability felt a little limited, so for Watch Dogs 2 , Ubisoft granted even more player freedom by greatly expanding the playable area, while also adding in new ways to mess around with the map. Watch Dogs Legion took this even further by granting the ability to switch characters on the fly, with players being encouraged to create their own mini-army of hackers to take over the City of London. What started out as Ubisoft's niche little experiment has blossomed into a massively popular open-world franchise that's only been growing in size over time, so it will be interesting to see how the developers take it to the next level in future installments.

item.title: Cookie Run Kingdom Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Jump Links

  • All Cookie Run Kingdom Codes
  • Cookie Run Kingdom Social Media
  • How to Redeem Codes in Cookie Run Kingdom

While not required for gameplay, Cookie Run Kingdom has offered many different special codes to help players with their gacha pulls. These codes can be found on various official social media pages such as Twitter and YouTube.

Updated October 11, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Cookie Run Kingdom currently features several active codes that provide valuable rewards. You can collect resources like Crystals, Rainbow Cubes, and other special items to boost your progress in the game. Make sure to redeem them soon and check back regularly for more code drops in upcoming updates.

All Cookie Run Kingdom Codes

Active Cookie Run Kingdom Codes

  • LIVETABLEREADSSK - (3,000 Crystals, 1,500 Rainbow Cube, 1,000 Choco Chalk) (NEW)

  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD1 (100 EXP Star Jelly Lv. 6)
  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD2 (3 Aurora Compass', 3 Aurora Pillars, 3 Aurora Bricks)
  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD3 (100 Topping Pieces)
  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD4 (500 Rainbow Cubes)
  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD5 (30 Time Jumpers)
  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD6 (10 Treasure Tickets)
  • CRK2NDBIRTHDAYD7 (3 Special Cookie Cutters)

Cookie Run Kingdom Social Media

There are multiple English social media accounts owned by the Cookie Run Kingdom staff. By following these accounts, players will be able to discover new redeemable codes when they are first released to the public. Some of these accounts are:

CRKingdomEN - Twitter

Cookie Run: Kingdom - YouTube

CRKingdomEN - Facebook

CookieRunKingdom - Instagram

CookieRun_En - TikTok

How to Redeem Codes in Cookie Run Kingdom

It is important to know that publicly released codes can only be used once per DevPlay account and cannot be endlessly used in one kingdom.

For the majority of players, the coupon redemption screen can be found by first entering the menu in the top right corner of the screen while outside of battle. In this menu, select the Coupons button to open up the web browser to the redemption screen.

Players who do not have the option to go directly to the redemption screen from in-game can still enter it by going to this website.

In order to enter a code, players need to have both a code and the name of their DevPlay account. Players can find the name of their DevPlay account by going into Cookie Run Kingdom 's Settings menu. From here, the name of the DevPlay account being used at the time can be found in the upper left corner of the Info tab. If the DevPlay account is an email address, the entire email address needs to be entered on the code redemption screen.

Once the process is complete, rewards will be received in the Mailbox and players can claim them right away.

110
9.5 /10

The secrets of the ancient Cookies and their kingdoms are waiting to be unraveled. Join GingerBrave and his friends against Dark Enchantress Cookie and her dark legion. The chronicles of CookieRun: Kingdom have just begun!

Create the ultimate Cookie team with endless combinations of Treasures and Toppings. Prove your battle skill in the Kingdom Arena, Cookie Alliance, Super Mayhem, and Guild Battles! Come up with different strategies to emerge victorious!

Reach the top of the ranking table with your fellow guildmates. Expand your guild's Domain and collect Guild Relics to become the strongest guild there is!

item.title: Roblox: Ultimate Football Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Football has always been popular in the gaming industry, with many fans enjoying their favorite game on the Roblox platform. The Ultimate Football developers have created a great game in which Roblox players have to try their best to win on the football field. To reward fans who enjoy the game, the developers also release Ultimate Football codes, all of which can be found below.

Updated October 11, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Ultimate Football has added a couple of new bonuses for you to grab this week. These fresh rewards can help you earn more in-game currency and gear to improve your roster and gameplay. If you’re building your collection or just getting started, now’s a good time to take advantage of the new offers. Keep checking back for the next set of updates and additional ways to earn free rewards.

Just like in many other Roblox games, the developers have added a huge number of codes, but most of them have already expired. Below is a list of all active codes, but they may also expire soon, so hurry up and get the rewards.

Codes Checked on October 11, 2025.

How to Redeem Codes in Ultimate Football

Similar to many Roblox games, the button to redeem codes can be found in the in-game menu. It is quite easy to find, and this is what players need to do:

  1. Open Roblox and launch Ultimate Football .
  2. Next, in the main menu, go to the Store tab.
  3. Go to the Redeem a Code section.
  4. Enter or paste the code in the Insert Code Here field and click on the tick. After that, the reward will be received.

Note that players who have just started playing the game will not be able to redeem codes. They must first spend 3 hours in Park Mode for this option to become available.

Roblox is home to an ever-expanding library of community-created worlds and experiences. Whether you’re in the mood for an epic role-playing adventure game or just want to hang out with your friends, there’s always something new and exciting to play.
Connect with friends and millions of players from around the world across Xbox One, computers, smartphones, tablets, and virtual reality devices.
Mix-and-match accessories, body parts, and more to customize your avatar. You can be anything you want to be: a ninja pirate, a mermaid princess, a robot wizard, the possibilities are limitless.

item.title: Roblox: Kick a Brainrot Codes (October 2025)
item.description:
Kick a Brainrot is a tycoon game that takes the popular Roblox concept of hatching creatures from eggs and raising them on a farm. However, the developers wanted to make the game unique, so they added cool mechanics that greatly increase the variety of gameplay. The main mechanic is described in the title: you need to kick a brainrot creature to add value to it. There are also mini-events that change the appearance of the map and add new eggs.

To make it easier for beginners to play, the developers have added a code redemption option. If you want to get cool rewards for free, redeem Kick a Brainrot codes from our list.

Updated October 11, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: Kick a Brainrot has new codes that offer limited-time boosts to help you earn and progress faster. You can use them to get temporary Cash and Luck bonuses, making your gameplay more rewarding. These boosts are especially useful for speeding up your progress and maximizing rewards. Be sure to check back often for more codes and upcoming updates.

All Kick a Brainrot Codes

Working Kick a Brainrot Codes

  • 90KLIKES - Redeem this code to get 1h Cash Boost. (NEW)
  • 25MVISITS - Redeem this code to get 1h Luck Boost. (NEW)

Expired Kick a Brainrot Codes

  • 85KLIKES
  • 300KMEMBERS
  • 80KLIKES
  • 20MVISITS
  • 70KLIKES
  • 250KMEMBERS
  • 5MVISITS
  • 25KLIKES
  • 1MVISITS
  • 10KLIKES

By redeeming Kick a Brainrot codes, you can get a rare egg or some in-game currency. So, regardless of your experience in the game, it will be useful to get a little freebie.

How to Redeem Codes in Kick a Brainrot

In most Roblox games, redeeming codes is straightforward. In this game, the “Codes” button is located directly in the game interface, making it easy to use. However, it is easy for newcomers to overlook, so to assist you, we have created a guide explaining how to redeem codes in Kick a Brainrot :

  • Launch Roblox and open Kick a Brainrot .
  • Look at the right side of the screen. Click the purple Codes button.
  • Paste the code from the list of working codes into the text field and click the checkmark button.

Remember, codes expire over time, so you need to redeem them as soon as possible to get rewards.

How to Get More Kick a Brainrot Codes

Sometimes you can find Roblox codes right in the game or on the page, but that's a rare thing. Usually, to find codes, you have to search for them in developers' social media accounts or on various gaming websites, and often, they are no longer valid. We regularly update our guides and add new working codes. To make sure you don't miss out on gifts, we recommend bookmarking this guide in your browser using the Ctrl+D key combination. But if you're more interested in the developers' social media accounts, you can follow the links below:

  • Kick a Brainrot Roblox game page
  • Kick a Brainrot Roblox group
  • Kick a Brainrot Discord server
